1.text: Moreover, brethren, I want you to know about the grace that God has given in the Churches of Macedonia:

2.text: in spite of extreme tribulations, the abundance of their joy (and their deep poverty) has resulted in generous giving.

3.text: I can testify that within their means and even beyond, they gave freely,

4.text: begging us to receive the grace to have such a participation in the ministry to the saints.

5.text: We had not hoped for so much, but first they gave themselves to the Lord and to us, by the will of God.

6.text: As a result, we urged Titus to bring this same grace to completion in you.

7.text: Yes, as you overflow in everything: faith, speech, knowledge, devotion, and [also] in your love for us, try to overflow even in this grace {of generous giving}.

8.text: I am not saying this as an order, but as testing your love by mentioning the devotion of others.

9.text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ: even though he was rich, yet he became poor for your sake, so that by his poverty you might become rich.

10.text: I give my opinion in this matter: it would be the right thing to do for you, since a year ago you were the first to do something (and this was also your will),

11.text: to complete what you were doing. Just as there was the readiness to be willing, may there [also] be completion {of this project} according to your means.

12.text: If you are ready, the gift is acceptable according to what one has—not according to what one does not have.

13.text: The goal is not that others may have it easy and that you would be in distress;

14.text: this is about a balancing out. In this present time, let your abundance make up for what others lack, so that their abundance also may become a supply for what you lack—that there may be equality.

15.text: As it is written, “The one who gathered much had nothing left over, but the one who gathered little was not in need.”

16.text: But thanks be to God who puts into Titus’ heart the same devotion for you.

17.text: He has accepted our exhortation, but since he was very eager, he [actually] went out to you of his own accord.

18.text: We have sent along with him the brother whose praise in the Good News is known in all the Churches.

19.text: In fact, he was also appointed by the Churches to accompany us with this grace, which we administer to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our zeal.

20.text: There is one thing that we want to avoid: that anyone should blame us about this general gift which we administer.

21.text: We endeavor to act honorably, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

22.text: We have sent with them our brother who has proven his eagerness in many ways, but now he is even more eager because of his great confidence in you.

23.text: Regarding Titus: he is my partner and fellow worker for your sake. As for our brothers, they are the apostles of the Churches, the glory of Christ.

24.text: Therefore, demonstrate your love to them before the Churches; show that we were right to boast about you to them.
